metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17846 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Enigmail before 1.9.9. Regular expressions are exploitable for Denial of Service, because of attempts to match arbitrarily long strings, aka TBE-01-003.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17846` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

enigmail - 2:1.9.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: enigmail package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.9.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
